text: Sargocentron coruscum, more commonly known as the reef squirrelfish, is a member of the family Holocentridae native to the western Atlantic Ocean from Florida, USA to northern South America. It lives over sandy and rocky substrates, as well as coral reefs, generally between deep. It is a nocturnal predator, feeding primarily on shrimps, but will also eat crabs. It searches for food alone or in small schools. It can reach sizes of up to TL. When alarmed, it will hide in crevices between corals. ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:Holocentridae Category:Fish described in 1860 Category:Fish of the Atlantic Ocean
title: Sargocentron coruscum
